required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Inhaled Insulin Compared With Subcutaneous Human Insulin Therapy in Adults With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Exubera® (Inhaled Insulin) Compared With Subcutaneous Human Insulin Therapy in Adult Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: A Long-Term, Outpatient, Open-Label, Parallel-Group Comparative Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is being done to find out the good and bad effects of inhaled insulin that is used by oral inhalation, to adult males and females with type 2 diabetes mellitus. The other name for this inhaled insulin is Exubera®.
This study included a 2-year comparative treatment period followed by a 6-month follow-up period during which inhaled insulin-treated subjects were switched back to subcutaneous short-acting insulin. After this follow-up period, all eligible subjects entered a comparative extension period that was to last for 5 years. When the comparative portion of the study was terminated, all subjects were requested to return for a final extension follow-up month 3 visit.

detailed_description.textblock: Pfizer announced in October 2007 that it would stop marketing Exubera. Nektar, the company from which Pfizer licensed Exubera, announced on April 9, 2008 that it had stopped its search for a new marketing partner. Accordingly, there will be no commercial availability of Exubera. As a result, study A2171029 was terminated on June 9, 2008. Neither safety nor efficacy reasons were the cause of the study termination.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Month 3 in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through extension follow up Month 3

secondary_outcome.measure: High Resolution Computerized Tomography (HRCT) Scan: Within Normal Limits (Yes or No) at Observation When Baseline HRCT Was Within Normal Limits

intervention.description: Inhaled insulin with dose adjusted according to premeal blood glucose
Subcutaneous insulin with dose adjusted according to premeal blood glucose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- COPD
- Asthma
- Smoking Pregnancy

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At screening visit and during the 4-week run-in phase subjects received subcutaneous insulin regime of 2 to 3 daily doses (QD) of regular insulin-/short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) and 1 or 2 doses QD of intermediate or long-acting insulin (neutral protamine hagedorn [NPH] insulin or Ultralente®) or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

participants_list.participants: At study termination, active subjects completed end-of-study assessment and 3-month follow-up visit
At study termination, active subjects completed end-of-study assessment and 3-month follow-up visit

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Age

outcome.title: Change From Month 3 in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
outcome.description: Change from Month 3: mean of (value of observed FEV1 [forced expiratory volume in the first second of forced exhalation] in liters [L] at treatment observation minus Month 3 value).
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension Month 60
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) FEV1: received at least 1 dose treatment, had baseline and at least 1 post-baseline FEV1. Due to study termination, originally planned inferential analysis for change from Month 3 through extension Month 60 was not done. Cross reference outcome measure: change from baseline in FEV1.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Change From Month 3 in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1)
measure.description: Change from Month 3: mean of (value of observed FEV1 [forced expiratory volume in the first second of forced exhalation] in liters [L] at treatment observation minus Month 3 value).
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) FEV1: received at least 1 dose treatment, had baseline and at least 1 post-baseline FEV1. Due to study termination, originally planned inferential analysis for change from Month 3 through extension Month 60 was not done. Cross reference outcome measure: change from baseline in FEV1.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FEV1
outcome.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed FEV1 [L] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS FEV1; extension Month 36 (M36) Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) based on data in the extension phase only; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively. Cross reference outcome measure: change from Month 3 in forced expiratory volume in 1 second.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in FEV1
measure.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed FEV1 [L] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
measure.population: FAS FEV1; extension Month 36 (M36) Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) based on data in the extension phase only; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively. Cross reference outcome measure: change from Month 3 in forced expiratory volume in 1 second.

outcome.title: Annual Rate of Change in FEV1
outcome.description: Annual rate of change in FEV1 calculated as slope over time [visit] for forced expiratory volume in 1 second measured as liters per year (L/yr).
outcome.time_frame: Week -2 through extension follow up Month 3 or end of study
outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Annual rate of change in FEV1 were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Annual Rate of Change in FEV1
measure.description: Annual rate of change in FEV1 calculated as slope over time [visit] for forced expiratory volume in 1 second measured as liters per year (L/yr).
measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Annual rate of change in FEV1 were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: Summary of ≥ 15 % Decliners in FEV1
outcome.description: Number of subjects with a post-baseline FEV1 decrease of ≥ 15 % [(baseline observed value - visit observed value)/(baseline observed value) * 100]; in the absence of an obvious intercurrrent illness, a repeat FEV1 was performed.
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS FEV1; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

measure.title: Summary of ≥ 15 % Decliners in FEV1
measure.description: Number of subjects with a post-baseline FEV1 decrease of ≥ 15 % [(baseline observed value - visit observed value)/(baseline observed value) * 100]; in the absence of an obvious intercurrrent illness, a repeat FEV1 was performed.
measure.population: FAS FEV1; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Annual Rate of Change in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco)
outcome.description: Annual rate of change in DLco calculated as slope over time (visit) measured as milliliters per minute per millimeters of mercury per year (ml/min/mmHg/yr).
outcome.time_frame: Week -2 through extension follow up Month 3 or end of study
outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Annual rate of change in DLco were not summarized as planned. Cross reference outcome measure: change from baseline in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco).

measure.title: Annual Rate of Change in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco)
measure.description: Annual rate of change in DLco calculated as slope over time (visit) measured as milliliters per minute per millimeters of mercury per year (ml/min/mmHg/yr).
measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Annual rate of change in DLco were not summarized as planned. Cross reference outcome measure: change from baseline in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco).

outcome.time_frame: Week -3 through extension follow up Month 3 or end of study
outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of FVC were not summarized as planned.

measure.title: Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)

measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of FVC were not summarized as planned.

outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of TLC were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)

measure.title: Total Lung Capacity (TLC)
measure.description: Total Lung Capacity measured in liters (L).
measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of TLC were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed HbA1c [%] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c: received at least 1 dose of study treatment, had baseline HbA1c and at least 1 post-baseline HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c)
measure.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed HbA1c [%] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
measure.population: FAS HbA1c: received at least 1 dose of study treatment, had baseline HbA1c and at least 1 post-baseline HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Total Daily Long-acting Insulin Dose (Unadjusted for Body Weight)
outcome.description: Total daily long-acting insulin dose unadjusted for body weight. Long-acting (units) insulin for inhaled insulin and subcutaneous treatment groups included NPH insulin, Ultralente®, and insulin glargine.
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

measure.title: Total Daily Long-acting Insulin Dose (Unadjusted for Body Weight)
measure.description: Total daily long-acting insulin dose unadjusted for body weight. Long-acting (units) insulin for inhaled insulin and subcutaneous treatment groups included NPH insulin, Ultralente®, and insulin glargine.
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Total Daily Long-acting Insulin (Adjusted for Body Weight)
outcome.description: Total daily dose of long-acting insulin adjusted for body weight (units per kilogram [kg]). Long-acting (units) insulin for inhaled insulin and subcutaneous treatment groups included NPH insulin, Ultralente®, and insulin glargine.
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Total Daily Long-acting Insulin (Adjusted for Body Weight)
measure.description: Total daily dose of long-acting insulin adjusted for body weight (units per kilogram [kg]). Long-acting (units) insulin for inhaled insulin and subcutaneous treatment groups included NPH insulin, Ultralente®, and insulin glargine.
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Total Daily Short-acting Insulin Dose (Unadjusted for Body Weight)
outcome.description: Total daily dose of short-acting insulin unadjusted for body weight. Short-acting insulin (milligrams [mg]) for the inhaled insulin treatment group was inhaled insulin; short-acting insulin (units) for the subcutaneous insulin treatment group included insulin lispro, insulin aspart, and regular insulin.
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®) (mg)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin (Units)
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Total Daily Short-acting Insulin Dose (Unadjusted for Body Weight)
measure.description: Total daily dose of short-acting insulin unadjusted for body weight. Short-acting insulin (milligrams [mg]) for the inhaled insulin treatment group was inhaled insulin; short-acting insulin (units) for the subcutaneous insulin treatment group included insulin lispro, insulin aspart, and regular insulin.
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Total Daily Short-acting Insulin Dose (Adjusted for Body Weight)
outcome.description: Total daily dose of short-acting insulin adjusted for body weight. Short-acting insulin (mg) for the inhaled insulin treatment group was inhaled insulin (mg divided by kg); short-acting insulin (units) for the subcutaneous insulin treatment group included insulin lispro, insulin aspart, and regular insulin (units divided by kg).
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®) (mg)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin (Units)
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Total Daily Short-acting Insulin Dose (Adjusted for Body Weight)
measure.description: Total daily dose of short-acting insulin adjusted for body weight. Short-acting insulin (mg) for the inhaled insulin treatment group was inhaled insulin (mg divided by kg); short-acting insulin (units) for the subcutaneous insulin treatment group included insulin lispro, insulin aspart, and regular insulin (units divided by kg).
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Lipid Panel: Total Cholesterol, High Density Lipoprotein, Low Density Lipoprotein, and Triglycerides
outcome.description: Lipid values for total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein (HDL), low density lipoprotein (LDL), and triglycerides measured as milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).
outcome.time_frame: Week -4 through Month 24
outcome.population: FAS: received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Lipids were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Lipid Panel: Total Cholesterol, High Density Lipoprotein, Low Density Lipoprotein, and Triglycerides
measure.description: Lipid values for total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein (HDL), low density lipoprotein (LDL), and triglycerides measured as milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).
measure.population: FAS: received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Lipids were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco)
outcome.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed DLco [milliliters per minute per millimeters of mercury (ml/min/mmHg)] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS FEV1; extension M36 LOCF based on data in the extension phase only; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively. Cross reference outcome measure Annual rate of change in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco).

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco)
measure.description: Change from baseline: mean of (value of observed DLco [milliliters per minute per millimeters of mercury (ml/min/mmHg)] at treatment observation minus baseline value).
measure.population: FAS FEV1; extension M36 LOCF based on data in the extension phase only; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively. Cross reference outcome measure Annual rate of change in Carbon Monoxide Diffusion Capacity (DLco).

outcome.title: Summary of ≥ 20 % Decliners in DLco
outcome.description: Number of subjects with a post-baseline DLco decrease of ≥ 20 % [(baseline observed value - visit observed value)/(baseline observed value) * 100]; in the absence of an obvious intercurrrent illness, a repeat DLco was performed.
outcome.time_frame: Month 3 through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS FEV1; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Summary of ≥ 20 % Decliners in DLco
measure.description: Number of subjects with a post-baseline DLco decrease of ≥ 20 % [(baseline observed value - visit observed value)/(baseline observed value) * 100]; in the absence of an obvious intercurrrent illness, a repeat DLco was performed.
measure.population: FAS FEV1; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Hypoglycemic Event Rates
outcome.description: Hypoglycemic event rate; hypoglycemic event identified by characteristic symptoms of hypoglycemia with no blood glucose (BG) check with prompt resolution with food intake, SC glucagon, or intravenous (IV) glucose; characteristic symptoms with BG of 59 mg/dL (3.2 mmol/L) or less with or without symptoms. Crude event rate = total events divided by subject months (elapsed number of months a subject was in the study at each time interval).
outcome.time_frame: Month 1 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Hypoglycemic Event Rates
measure.description: Hypoglycemic event rate; hypoglycemic event identified by characteristic symptoms of hypoglycemia with no blood glucose (BG) check with prompt resolution with food intake, SC glucagon, or intravenous (IV) glucose; characteristic symptoms with BG of 59 mg/dL (3.2 mmol/L) or less with or without symptoms. Crude event rate = total events divided by subject months (elapsed number of months a subject was in the study at each time interval).
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Severe Hypoglycemic Event Rates
outcome.description: Severe hypoglycemic event rate; all 3 criteria were met: subject unable to treat self, exhibited at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable behavior, irrational behavior, unusual difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness); BG measurement ≤49 mg/dL, or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates, SC glucagon, or IV glucose. Crude event rate: total events divided by subject months multiplied by 100 ([total events/subject months]*100). Subjects months: elapsed number of months subject was in study in each time interval.
outcome.time_frame: Month 1 through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Severe Hypoglycemic Event Rates
measure.description: Severe hypoglycemic event rate; all 3 criteria were met: subject unable to treat self, exhibited at least 1 neurological symptom (memory loss, confusion, uncontrollable behavior, irrational behavior, unusual difficulty awakening, suspected seizure, loss of consciousness); BG measurement ≤49 mg/dL, or not measured but clinical manifestations reversed by oral carbohydrates, SC glucagon, or IV glucose. Crude event rate: total events divided by subject months multiplied by 100 ([total events/subject months]*100). Subjects months: elapsed number of months subject was in study in each time interval.
measure.population: FAS HbA1c; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and SC insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: Cough Questionnaire
outcome.description: Clinician administered 6 question instrument to measure cough frequency (night, day), severity, timing in relation to short-acting insulin dosing, severity related to insulin dosing (SC or inhaled), and productivity of cough; range 0 (indicates no symptoms) to 4 (indicates severe symptoms). Questionnaire administered at Week 0 then if and only if, cough is identified as an adverse event not explained by a concomitant condition, such as an upper respiratory tract infection.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 and if indicated through extension follow up Month 3
outcome.population: FAS. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Cough Questionnaire were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Cough Questionnaire
measure.description: Clinician administered 6 question instrument to measure cough frequency (night, day), severity, timing in relation to short-acting insulin dosing, severity related to insulin dosing (SC or inhaled), and productivity of cough; range 0 (indicates no symptoms) to 4 (indicates severe symptoms). Questionnaire administered at Week 0 then if and only if, cough is identified as an adverse event not explained by a concomitant condition, such as an upper respiratory tract infection.
measure.population: FAS. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of Cough Questionnaire were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI)
outcome.description: Clinician administered instrument to measure the baseline severity of breathlessness (shortness of breath) in symptomatic patients with 3 domains: functional impairment, magnitude of task, and magnitude of effort. BDI score range 0 (very severe impairment) to 4 (no impairment) scaled to a BDI focal score (0–12). Lower score indicates greater impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Week -1
outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of BDI were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Baseline Dyspnea Index (BDI)
measure.description: Clinician administered instrument to measure the baseline severity of breathlessness (shortness of breath) in symptomatic patients with 3 domains: functional impairment, magnitude of task, and magnitude of effort. BDI score range 0 (very severe impairment) to 4 (no impairment) scaled to a BDI focal score (0–12). Lower score indicates greater impairment.
measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of BDI were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI)
outcome.description: Clinician administered instrument to measure the baseline severity of breathlessness (shortness of breath) in symptomatic patients with 3 domains: functional impairment, magnitude of task, and magnitude of effort. TDI score range -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement); sum of all domains yields the TDI focal score (–9 to +9); lower score indicates greater deterioration. Compared to previous scoring to determine deterioration or improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Week 4 through extension follow up Month 3 or end of study
outcome.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of TDI were not summarized as planned.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI)
measure.description: Clinician administered instrument to measure the baseline severity of breathlessness (shortness of breath) in symptomatic patients with 3 domains: functional impairment, magnitude of task, and magnitude of effort. TDI score range -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement); sum of all domains yields the TDI focal score (–9 to +9); lower score indicates greater deterioration. Compared to previous scoring to determine deterioration or improvement.
measure.population: FAS FEV1. Due to early termination of study a limited set of analyses were undertaken and results of TDI were not summarized as planned.

outcome.title: High Resolution Computerized Tomography (HRCT) Scan: Within Normal Limits (Yes or No) at Observation When Baseline HRCT Was Within Normal Limits
outcome.description: Number of subjects with Yes or No responses (within normal limits at specified time points = Yes or not within normal limits at specified time points = No) at observation when HRCT of thorax was within normal limits at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, M12, M24, Ext M6, Ext M18, Ext M36
outcome.population: All subjects analysis substudy population: subjects from participating sites with a baseline and subsequent post-baseline HRCT measurement. Subjects were recruited prior to randomization; substudy enrollment continued until at least 50 subjects randomized to inhaled insulin were enrolled or until enrollment in the study was complete.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: High Resolution Computerized Tomography (HRCT) Scan: Within Normal Limits (Yes or No) at Observation When Baseline HRCT Was Within Normal Limits
measure.description: Number of subjects with Yes or No responses (within normal limits at specified time points = Yes or not within normal limits at specified time points = No) at observation when HRCT of thorax was within normal limits at baseline.
measure.population: All subjects analysis substudy population: subjects from participating sites with a baseline and subsequent post-baseline HRCT measurement. Subjects were recruited prior to randomization; substudy enrollment continued until at least 50 subjects randomized to inhaled insulin were enrolled or until enrollment in the study was complete.

outcome.title: High Resolution Computerized Tomography (HRCT) Scan: Within Normal Limits (Yes or No) at Observation When Baseline HRCT Was Not Within Normal Limits
outcome.description: Number of subjects with Yes or No responses (within normal limits at specified time points = Yes or not within normal limits at specified time points = No) at observation when HRCT of thorax was not within normal limits at baseline. "No" response at observation further categorized as no significant change (NSC), more abnormal (> Abn), or less abnormal (< Abn).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, M12, M24, Ext M6, Ext M18, Ext M36
outcome.population: All subjects analysis substudy population: subjects from participating sites with a baseline and subsequent post-baseline HRCT measurement. Subjects were recruited prior to randomization; substudy enrollment continued until at least 50 subjects randomized to inhaled insulin were enrolled or until enrollment in the study was complete.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: High Resolution Computerized Tomography (HRCT) Scan: Within Normal Limits (Yes or No) at Observation When Baseline HRCT Was Not Within Normal Limits
measure.description: Number of subjects with Yes or No responses (within normal limits at specified time points = Yes or not within normal limits at specified time points = No) at observation when HRCT of thorax was not within normal limits at baseline. "No" response at observation further categorized as no significant change (NSC), more abnormal (> Abn), or less abnormal (< Abn).
measure.population: All subjects analysis substudy population: subjects from participating sites with a baseline and subsequent post-baseline HRCT measurement. Subjects were recruited prior to randomization; substudy enrollment continued until at least 50 subjects randomized to inhaled insulin were enrolled or until enrollment in the study was complete.

outcome.title: Insulin Antibodies
outcome.description: Observed values for insulin antibodies measured as micro units per milliliter (microU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through extension Month 36
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with analyzable data at observation: inhaled insulin/SC insulin, respectively. Insulin antibody levels increased in Exubera®-treated compared to control subjects; results are included to establish there were no safety consequences due to these elevations although this was not an originally specified protocol endpoint.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

measure.title: Insulin Antibodies
measure.description: Observed values for insulin antibodies measured as micro units per milliliter (microU/mL).
measure.population: FAS; (n)=number of subjects with analyzable data at observation: inhaled insulin/SC insulin, respectively. Insulin antibody levels increased in Exubera®-treated compared to control subjects; results are included to establish there were no safety consequences due to these elevations although this was not an originally specified protocol endpoint.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events for this study are reported using MedDRA in Basic Results but are reported using COSTART in the Clinical Study Report (CSR) and PhRMA Web Synopsis (PWS) for consistency with earlier studies. Consequently, subtle differences may be observed.

group.title: Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhalable short-acting insulin (INH) regime (packaged as 1 mg and 3 mg inhalation blister packs) plus a single bedtime dose or 2 daily doses of either Ultralene® or NPH insulin, or insulin glargine once daily (QD) at bedtime.

group.title: Subcutaneous Insulin
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin: 2 to 3 daily doses of regular insulin or short-acting insulin analog (lispro or aspart) plus 1 or 2 daily doses of an intermediate to long-acting insulin (NPH insulin or Ultralene®), or insulin glargine QD at bedtime.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to early termination of study, none of the subjects completed the study as planned. Subjects active at the time of study termination completed an end-of-study assessment and a 3-month follow-up visit.
